pullRequest.title: Incorrect JMX stats for queued queries

nodes.bodyText: I've added these assertions just to illustrate the problem.  I'll remove them once we settle on a way to address it.

This doesn't match the semantics of RunningQueries from QueryManagerStats - that class counted a query as running only when transitioning to RUNNING state, which counted queries in all previous states as QueuedQueries, which didn't seem right.  This mimics the logic used to display running queries on the UI.

commit.message:
Fix tracking of queued queries in JMX stats

Transfer the responsibility of exposing query manager stats to
DispatchManager. Stop tracking RunningQueries and QueuedQueries in
QueryManagerStats, since they were not computed accurately. Expose
MBean attributes with the same names based on information obtained
from QueryTracker.
Check more often if the state we're waiting for has been reached

afterCommit.message: Check more often if the state we're waiting for has been reached

nodes.bodyText:
Will this scale for cluster with large number of concurrent queries? The JMX scrape intervals can be as low as 10 seconds. So is calling getAllQueries() at 6 rpm OK for the cluster?
I too prefer this change since everything is simpler now but am concerned about the above point.
